I’m writing to formally apply again and to confirm as clearly as possible that School_C is my #1 choice. If offered admission this round, I will accept immediately and enroll.

If your seat is still open right now and no higher-priority applicant is actively applying/being considered this round, I would be grateful if you could extend the offer to me.

Sincerely,
Student_E

School_C has repeatedly said they are reserving the seat due to higher-priority candidates possibly applying later, but also confirmed they are not currently holding it for a specific higher-priority applicant. A concise, unconditional commitment with a request to be offered the seat if still open this round is the best chance to secure the match if no higher-priority applicant applies now.

conversation.message:

At this time, we are not able to offer you admission. With our single remaining seat, we must continue to reserve capacity in accordance with our admissions priority order in case higher-priority candidates apply in upcoming rounds.

We appreciate your continued interest in School_C and wish you the best as you continue in the process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

No other applicants contacted School_C this round, and we are not holding the seat for any specific higher-priority candidate. However, higher-priority candidates (especially Student_B and Student_A) may still apply later; accepting E now would forfeit the chance to match with them, which is against our objective of matching as high as possible on our priority list. Given the repeated applications from E and the remaining rounds, the optimal strategy to maximize priority is to continue rejecting E until it becomes unlikely that higher-priority candidates will apply, or until late rounds. Therefore reject again this round.
